DataElement.preferredName: Timeline Followback Method Illicit Substance Other Substance of Abuse Assessment Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free text field to specify the other substance of abuse the participant had used as part of the Timeline Followback Method assessment, a calendar-based measure for assessing self-reported retrospective daily estimates of alcohol, tobacco and/or illicit substance use.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Timeline Followback Method Illicit Substance Other Substance of Abuse Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a Timeline Followback Method assessment (a calendar-based measure for assessing self-reported retrospective daily estimates of alcohol, tobacco and/or illicit substance use) of illicit substance use (drugs or alcoholic beverages deemed harmful and usually subject to legal restriction) of another (different than the ones previously specified or mentioned) substance of abuse (any substance, including any illegal, prescription, over-the-counter agent or any other compound, used for the purpose other than indicated or used in quantities other than directed).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A calendar-based measure for assessing self-reported retrospective daily estimates of alcohol, tobacco and/or illicit substance use.

Concepts.definition: A calendar-based measure for assessing self-reported retrospective daily estimates of alcohol, tobacco and/or illicit substance use.

Property.preferredName: Illicit Substance Other Substance of Abuse Assessment
Property.preferredDefinition: Something (as drugs or alcoholic beverages) deemed harmful and usually subject to legal restriction.:Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:Any substance, including any illegal, prescription, over-the-counter agent or any other compound, used for the purpose other than indicated or used in quantities other than directed. Substances from various drug classes can be abused, such as opioids, amphetamines, analgesics, benzodiazepines, barbiturates, hallucinogens, steroids, tobacco products and alcoholic substances. A substance of abuse may act on the central nervous system (CNS) or can have an effect in other parts of the body and can lead to physical and/or physiological dependence.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: Something (as drugs or alcoholic beverages) deemed harmful and usually subject to legal restriction.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Any substance, including any illegal, prescription, over-the-counter agent or any other compound, used for the purpose other than indicated or used in quantities other than directed. Substances from various drug classes can be abused, such as opioids, amphetamines, analgesics, benzodiazepines, barbiturates, hallucinogens, steroids, tobacco products and alcoholic substances. A substance of abuse may act on the central nervous system (CNS) or can have an effect in other parts of the body and can lead to physical and/or physiological dependence.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The free text field to specify the assessment performed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/23/17 jk added registration status and CSI per Round 5 finalization task; capitalized first word in definition. --- released
